title: Cozy One Pot Pasta Dishes for Busy Nights

description: This one pot pasta dish is the perfect solution for busy nights, combining comfort and flavor in a single pot. With minimal cleanup and maximum taste, it's a family favorite that will have everyone asking for seconds.
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add pasta, vegetable broth, cherry tomatoes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add spinach and cook for an additional 5 minutes until wilted.
Serve hot, topped with Parmesan cheese.
tips: For a creamier sauce, add a splash of heavy cream or a dollop of cream cheese just before serving.

Preparation:
Start by measuring out your ingredients. Chop the tomatoes and rinse the spinach.
Cooking/Baking Process:

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Stirring occasionally helps prevent the pasta from sticking.
  • A common mistake is overcooking the pasta; keep an eye on it!
  • When the pasta is al dente, it's ready to serve.
  • This dish can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days and reheated easily.
